intro: Scorpiurus subvillosus, commonly known as the hairy false nettle, is a flowering plant native to parts of North America. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Scorpiurus subvillosus is often found in the understory of forests and is known for its mild, somewhat peppery taste when harvested young.
